transparency_law.name: Louisiana Public Records Act
transparency_law.statute_citation: Louisiana Revised Statutes Title 44, Chapter 1 § 44:1 et seq.

response_requirements.initial_response_description: Reasonable time based on nature and extent of records requested. Agencies must respond promptly. Legal action may be initiated within 5 days of request.
response_requirements.no_response_consequence: After 5 business days, may file direct court action. $100 per day civil penalty against custodian for arbitrary refusal.

fee_structure.standard_copy_fee: Reasonable fees for reproduction and processing (typically per page)
fee_structure.notes: Agencies may charge reasonable fees. Specific fee schedules vary by agency. Includes copying costs, staff time, mailing and shipping costs.

exemptions.description: Pending criminal litigation records until finally adjudicated. Initial officer reports ARE public. Booking records, summons/citation records, and bill of information filing records are public.
Trade secrets and proprietary business information
Records of deaths by other than natural causes: Access after 10 years with court approval

appeal_process.appeal_description: No administrative appeal - direct court access after 5 business days. Cases heard by preference and in summary manner. Appellate courts place on preferential docket.

penalties.civil: $100 per day civil penalty against custodian for arbitrary refusal (runs from end of 5-day response period, excludes weekends/holidays). Prevailing plaintiffs awarded reasonable attorney fees and costs.

requester_requirements.specific_format: Any person of the age of majority may examine records. Governor's Office requests limited to Louisiana residents only.
requester_requirements.notes: Since 1978 amendments, any person of legal age may request. Some agencies may require residency verification.

specific_obligations: Make custodian contact information readily available to public
Provide records unless specifically exempted by law

oversight_body.name: No centralized oversight - Direct court enforcement
oversight_body.role: Judicial enforcement through district courts. No administrative appeal process.
oversight_body.contact_info: Cases filed in district court with preferential docket treatment
enforcement_powers: Court may issue injunction or writ of mandamus
Cases heard by preference and in summary manner
Appellate courts place on preferential docket
Award attorney fees and costs to prevailing plaintiffs
